title: Update regarding OmniCorp
story_body:
Industry-Wide Shortages of High-Reliability Interconnects and Specialty Substrates Disrupt OMNI's Supply Chain

A perfect storm of unprecedented demand and constrained supply has led to a severe shortage of high-reliability interconnects and specialty substrates, affecting multiple industry stakeholders, including OMNI (OmniCorp). The scarcity of these critical components has sent shockwaves throughout the sector, as manufacturers struggle to maintain production levels.

At the heart of the issue lies the dearth of high-reliability interconnects, specifically those meeting the stringent requirements of MIL-STD-883 and MIL-STD-750. These components, essential for ensuring the reliability and performance of high-reliability applications, are in short supply due to capacity constraints at key manufacturers. The shortage has been further exacerbated by the increasing adoption of advanced packaging technologies, such as 2.5D and 3D stacked die, which rely heavily on these specialized interconnects.

Compounding the problem is the scarcity of specialty substrates, including low-loss, high-frequency laminates and ceramic-based substrates. These materials are critical for the production of high-frequency and high-power applications, including those employed in OMNI's product lines. The shortage of these substrates has been attributed to the limited production capacity of key suppliers, as well as the increasing demand for 5G and IoT applications.

OMNI, like its industry peers, is feeling the pinch of these shortages. The company's reliance on these critical components has resulted in production delays and, in some cases, the inability to fulfill customer orders. While OMNI has implemented contingency plans to mitigate the impact of the shortages, the company's supply chain remains vulnerable to these sector-wide disruptions.

The industry-wide shortages of high-reliability interconnects and specialty substrates serve as a stark reminder of the complexity and interconnectedness of the global supply chain. As demand for advanced technologies continues to rise, manufacturers must navigate these challenges to ensure the continued delivery of high-reliability products to their customers.
